website_summaries.verdict: If you are pressed for space in your vehicle and need a reliable traction mat for when snow, mud, or sand become an issue, you can’t go wrong with this model.
pros: Folds up to fit small spaces, like under truck seats
cons: They only work when oriented in a certain direction

customer_reviews.title: PEOPLE ARE PUTTING THEM UPSIDE DOWN!!
customer_reviews.text: Some people say they shoot right out from under their tires. THEY ARE DIRECTIONAL! DON'T LAY THEM DOWN UPSIDE DOWN!! There is a hard to see label molded into the end indicating which side is UP.
customer_reviews.author: MassMan

customer_reviews.title: Saved our butts!!
customer_reviews.text: These saved us from being stuck in the mud in remote Utah. It took a quite awhile to back up 100 feet but we just kept putting these under the rear tires, backing up a few feet and then repeating the process. I would recommend getting a longer set or maybe two sets.
customer_reviews.author: jmohleca

customer_reviews.title: Shot out from under wheels, shattered
customer_reviews.text: I had to use these this winter when my Ford E-350 van got stuck in snow. I placed them under the rear drive wheels, with the correct side up as indicated by the molded-in 'this side up' label. The tires simply gripped them & pulled them underneath & shot them at high speed towards the front of the vehicle. In other words, they gripped to the tires but not to the ground. When they hit somewhere on the underbody of the vehicle, they shattered in multiple places. These simply did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Theodore the job!
customer_reviews.text: They were the perfect thing that I needed to get unstuck. Placed them next to the rear tires and was able to get enough traction to get unstuck. They worked great!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these!!!!  They might work on your child's Tonka toys but that's it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and threw them in my car for when I might need them. I REALLY regret not opening the box 1st. These might as well of come out a gumball machine!! Worthless, thin, tiny, junk. Needless to say I'm still stuck. They both slid out immediately and one damaged front fender when it flew up into it. Definitely DO NOT waste your money on these!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn B

customer_reviews.title: Saved me this winter when I got stuck in my own driveway!
customer_reviews.text: We had a sudden heavy snowfall and my truck is just 2 wheel drive so even a small snow drift will have it spinning it's tires. I bought these traction mats last summer figuring I may need them and just threw them behind the seat. Glad I did because they got the truck moving enough to get unstuck and get to town for a doctors appointment. Look at the direction of the treads on the mat and you want them to bite in to the snow or they will just slip right out under the truck tire. You may need to put them in front or back of the tire to get enough movement to free your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: LaMar

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I read a handful of reviews. Looks like half the people that rated 4* didn't even use the product. I found myself in difficult rough-rocky sand in my FWD van. I thought "perfect opportunity to try these out, as I've had them sitting for over a year." It's better used as a crappy shovel. Either there was too much traction and driving would just kick the thing out behind your wheel, or there is too little traction and the tire would just rub up against it and nothing would happen.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Jess

customer_reviews.title: We're 2 for 2 on getting unstuck
customer_reviews.text: I have used these two times so far for getting unstuck. First time was last year with my wife's Hyundai Elantra that was stuck in some deep wet snow. Second time I just used them with a big rear wheel drive passenger van that was stuck on some snow and ice trying to get up a slightly inclined driveway. Worked well both times! I am giving these 5 stars and would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Easy to store in my Jeep 🚙 and they got me right out of some very soft sand at the Jersey shore.
customer_reviews.author: CDB

customer_reviews.title: Don't work
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these. I bought them hoping to never need them, but I got stuck in the driveway last week and needed them. They are not long enough... at least I think that was the problem. When I gently pushed the gas. after placing this under the tires, it would catch but just flung them 5 feet back behind the wheel and the car went nowhere. I was glad no one was standing there to get hit by flying plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Works great if used correctly
customer_reviews.text: As other have said, it’s a bit hard to see which way is up. Learning what each side feels like might help. Don’t let your tires spin too much on them or of course, they will fly out. Used them to get out of our gravel driveway after four feet of snow and a fun extra bit from the snowplow. Got us over the last bump of snow at the end of the drive, which is an uphill drive. Could be bigger, but then they’d take up more room when stored.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: It can be easily stuck in the icy road due to the light ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the snowiest winter in Massachusetts. We have a Toyota Prius. It can be easily stuck in the icy road due to the light weight. So we bought this traction mat. The product is small, light, easy to store in car. We used it once, it provides enough traction to get us out of the slippery situation.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Steddom

customer_reviews.title: Worked to get my truck unstuck from muddy field
customer_reviews.text: I've a 3/4 ton truck and this saved my ass a few times when I was not paying too much attention got stuck in the mud (we've had two very wet years in Pennsylvania!). Would recommend to have it around just in case. Also useful for snow & ice, and if you have a trailer it realliy can save you a lot of time, money and hassle to avoid having to get towed. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: madrobby

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today, used them....perfect. To all the people saying that they shoot out under the tires ...well the only thing I can think of is perhapes they'll not putting them on the correct side of the tire or the right side up because if you can get these under your tire then you're going to get traction. Just don't gun it. Ease on the accelerator. The best part is they fold up so small so you can store them neat and out of the way. Under the seat works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen from Denver

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Got stuck, so I thought... Hey! Time to try and use these! ... The tire just shot them out. They didn't grip whatsoever. Waste of time and money, ended up getting towed out anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Nix

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing, but not particularly good
customer_reviews.text: I tried using these to get my car out from a frozen rut, which I expected to be difficult. However, even when I got the mat under the tire, the tire still spun on the mat, wearing it down considerably in just a few seconds. I wouldn't call them completely useless, and they fold up very small, but there are much more effective products out there.
customer_reviews.author: Remus Vintila

customer_reviews.title: Up up and escape!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has saved my bacon in the snow numerous times already. Really easy to use and it folds up to a very compact size. Would make a great addition to your car's winter emergency kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: They didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use these under the tires of a truck that got stuck in an icy snow rut on a city street. Several times the truck's tires' spinning made the tracks shoot out from underneath toward us when we were pushing the truck from behind - super dangerous. We tried repositioning them and turning them upside-down instead to no avail. I feel these were a waste of my money. During our struggle with this guy's truck, a woman came along with cat litter, and *that* worked. So I will pitch these tracks and keep cat litter in my car instead from now on.
customer_reviews.author: C. Huber

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Well was expecting these tracks to help against the Minnesota weather, recently got 9in of snow and my car was snowed in. Shoveled the majority of the snow but my wheels still wouldn’t get any traction. Tried the tracks and they did no good, had to turn traction control off and power my way through which melted the tracks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. When I got stuck and placed them under my tire, they would just shoot out the other side. Did not work at all
customer_reviews.author: Joe Messer

customer_reviews.title: Happy I Got Them-Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Should be a nice addition to my winter emergency kit in my trunk. These feel really well made, and fold up small for storage. The description on the packaging is entertaining as well. Happy I got them.
customer_reviews.author: Renesis79

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Nice peace of mind, until you actually need them... Got stuck in mud... they worked getting me out of one rut, but not the second... had to get a pull out of mud from the neighbors tractor. So, for smaller issues it worked, for deeper, no.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob's Well

customer_reviews.title: Space saving foldable auto traction mat
customer_reviews.text: Being stuck in the snow or mud are reasons why I sometimes hate driving, but with the help of this foldable auto traction mat I am able to get out of these situations unscathed. It is foldable so I don't have to worry that it will take up space in my car's trunk.
customer_reviews.author: LaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLa

customer_reviews.title: This is a mat to put under your car tires for traction. They work great for that purpose!
customer_reviews.text: This is a mat to put under your car tires for traction. They work great for that purpose! They fold small for storing in a car and work great when traction is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert55

customer_reviews.title: A winter must
customer_reviews.text: These definitely work. It snowed overnight about 1’ 1/2” and I used them to get another vehicle unstuck. I found the best way to use these were to lay one across under the tire then the other on top of it leanth wise of the car. Worked great!!! I’m bying another set for my other vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: Tried these 3 times this winter when stuck on slick ice and snow and they did not work at all
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: A great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. Only drawback is cleaning them after use but that is a minor detail. I'll be putting a set of these in each vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Will do the job
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool. Well made and they fold up which makes them versatile. Good quality construction which means they are well made. Worth piece of mind having them around.
customer_reviews.author: Mavis Shanks

customer_reviews.title: Useless product - very SAD.
customer_reviews.text: Wasted my hard earned money, they all broken , now my car stuck in mud. I had to pay neighbor giving me ride to rental car office, so I will not lose my job. $300 for rental car . AAA won’t provide tow services in the area .
customer_reviews.author: False advertisement. Very disappointed

customer_reviews.title: Let me down
customer_reviews.text: Does not work in the snow!!! Got stuck with my Corolla and tried to get unstuck did not work and was broken first try the other pieces got launched! Unless you enjoy wasting your money... this is not for the use with any vehicle!
customer_reviews.author: Dara

customer_reviews.title: but appear to be sturdy and made better than the ones that I replaced
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully will not need these again for several months, but appear to be sturdy and made better than the ones that I replaced. Fold into a convenient size for storage.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Works if used as directed.
customer_reviews.text: Already got me out of a mudhole. And the vehicle was likely over the stated weight limits with no issues to the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jon DE

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these, get real rescue boards instead.
customer_reviews.text: These mickey mouse rescue boards are a literal joke. I was stuck in mud with them and couldn't even get the tires to gain traction on them let alone have them hold on the soil. These are a literal joke. Don't waste your money, buy real rescue boards instead of these.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get stuck no more(within reason)
customer_reviews.text: Have used with a 7 ton bucket truck multiple times and they are holding up. You live in the northeast and deal with snow and mud in the same week? I’d buy these. Easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t used it yet.
customer_reviews.text: I will update to five star once I’ve used it but for what it is it seems durable and high quality. We like camping and we have a camper van that’s not a 4x4 this can be an issue on certain areas and we bought this just Incase of an emergency
customer_reviews.author: @Mr&MrsC

customer_reviews.title: looks bigger in the picture
customer_reviews.text: Very small does it work? if it does not by much just put it in your tool-shed and laugh
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Mouse

customer_reviews.title: To me these where TRASH, i tried getting out ...
customer_reviews.text: To me these where TRASH, i tried getting out of some sugar sand and my truck swallowed them and snapped both of these when i tried backing up with these underneath...
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: So far looks good
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried these yet, but they have a great design.
customer_reviews.author: Diamondrocks

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Compact
customer_reviews.text: I like how compact and sturdy the tracks are. There is no substitute for safety in winter.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: i got stuck in the snow, and they worked as advertised. Living in NE, you've got to have them.
customer_reviews.author: Ostap Bender

customer_reviews.title: Not for snow
customer_reviews.text: Was useless in snow. Ice no problem snow unless shallow no change I mean like less than 3 inches.
customer_reviews.author: MR G A MCLEOD

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it
customer_reviews.text: This thing wouldn’t be adequate for a 4 wheeler let alone a car.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Evans

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: When I used this item they didn’t want to stay in place. They flew out from under the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma K

customer_reviews.title: Instructions not visible
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have chance to use it yet, bought it just for incase, product look good enough for compact car SUV. Just the instructions should be more visible.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to my escape arsenal. Haven't used yet, but appears to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Baxter

customer_reviews.title: OK but not long enough to be of real value
customer_reviews.text: These were wide enough but could easily be much more value on snow/mud if they were 6-10" longer. They are too short to be of real value.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D.

customer_reviews.title: Worked eventually
customer_reviews.text: Took a couple of tries to get my vehicle out of the snow, it kept flying out from underneath and not staying under the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Helps a little bit when getting stuck. Tread on ...
customer_reviews.text: Helps a little bit when getting stuck. Tread on tracks is not very thick and is hard for tires to grab onto. The end of the track also melted/shredded from the tire spinning on it.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb b

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: smaller than expected but kept to have just in case
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: A couple of pieces of asphalt roofing work really well on ice
customer_reviews.text: Never worked for me. I can't imagine a scenario where these would be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lewis

customer_reviews.title: but I feel happy knowing that I have them
customer_reviews.text: Thank God I haven't had to use them yet, but I feel happy knowing that I have them.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Takes up no space & is there when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: SRBW

customer_reviews.title: Good for it’s price
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think it will get you out from super muddy situations but it will definitely help you with light mud. I wish it was a little bit wider though.
customer_reviews.author: David g.

customer_reviews.title: Not for offroad tires
customer_reviews.text: This are meant for normal tires, if you have off-road tires, I don’t think they will work since it’s not the width of offroadtires
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Too cheap to be useful. I had a metal pair years ago. They were Awesome (I live in Alaska) can't find them anymore :(.
customer_reviews.author: John Haverlack

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and is small enough to store away
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does nothing.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me in a foot of snow. Too small.
customer_reviews.author: bim

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for off-road use
customer_reviews.text: Not very wide but they seem like they’d the job.
customer_reviews.author: Alex W.

customer_reviews.title: measurements
customer_reviews.text: It's to small..... should have had measurements up front so customer would know.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: They didn't work broke when I tried to use them. Do NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Carlo T.

customer_reviews.title: Unstuck in sand
customer_reviews.text: Surprised people are not aware of this tool. I like to go to beach on the sand and a lot of cars stuck there including me. This is the best way to unstuck. I was surprised how sturdy this plastic thing is. I got another set so I can use them for both front and rear wheels. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: GEW

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We use this product to avoid sinking of 4x4 SUV in sand or mud
customer_reviews.author: Ilana

customer_reviews.title: Helpful and easy
customer_reviews.text: Thank you :) really helpful and easy to use :)
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: A rock, or plank of wood would be more useful.
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use them many times, trying every possible orientation. Always needed to find another way to get unstuck
customer_reviews.author: Riptide

customer_reviews.title: Supper skinny n short, got stuck in sand my ...
customer_reviews.text: Supper skinny n short, got stuck in sand my tires just spit them out behind n buried them.also they have hinges on them so it's not giving you a gradual slope ramp to get out of the hole your tire is in.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: These are horrible. I got stuck plowing in my driveway where ...
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible. I got stuck plowing in my driveway where my tires kept spinning. I was excited to try these out for the first time but the excitement didn't last long. I placed them up against the back of my front two tires and tried backing out. As soon as my tires came in contact with them, they slid under the tires and shot into the snow bank in front of my truck. I tried two more times and once with the back tires and the same thing happened every time. I grabbed a little bit of sand and threw it behind my tires and drove right out.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Broyer

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty flimsy and not really very grippy
customer_reviews.text: My car is RWD so we used these light tracks on the front tires when we could; we used the other heavier tracks on the rear/drive tires. These are pretty flimsy and not really very grippy, but they do provide more stability than pure snow. They helped get me out. They are very compact so I'm keeping them in my car now, even though they're not the full "solution" when stuck.
customer_reviews.author: EarthLaunch

customer_reviews.title: This works fine. Just don't expect to understand the laughably-bad "English" ...
customer_reviews.text: This works fine. Just don't expect to understand the laughably-bad "English" instructions. You don't instructions for this though.
customer_reviews.author: Doug S.

customer_reviews.title: Fits easily in my truck so I will always be prepared for the ice and snow.
customer_reviews.text: Fits easily in my truck so I will always be prepared for the ice and snow.
customer_reviews.author: G. Crinnion

customer_reviews.title: Probably not for my Jeep well see
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used yet but it’s really small check dimensions. Might help a tiny car don’t think Jeep or trucks gonna benefit from this one. Folds up nice an small

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than it looks, don't think it would ...
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than it looks, don't think it would work very well with a truck, but have not tried it yet.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work at all, not one bit
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work at all for my BMW. I mean, it didn’t even work at all, my car did not even get up on these.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like it was a child's toy as far as quality. Returned.

customer_reviews.title: but very pleased with buying/shipping experience
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. These are a Christmas present so I can't speak to the quality yet, but very pleased with buying/shipping experience.

customer_reviews.title: Was a gift for grandson who lives in Colorado. ...
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for grandson who lives in Colorado. A "just in case" item to keep in the car should he need them.

customer_reviews.text: Looked great but ran out of snow to try it out this year.

customer_reviews.text: The directions on the box are written in horrible English. Other than that I expect it to work as intended. Quality of plastic feels robust.

customer_reviews.text: I haven't needed to use these yet but I tested them & I am impressed with the apparent ease of use. Certianly beats having to dig a couple trenches to get unstuck

customer_reviews.title: Seemed great out of the box....
customer_reviews.text: Product packaging was great. Comes with a great carrying case as well. First impression was good! Product is build with sturdy materials, and feels as if it could handle being roughed up quite a bit. All was good, until I closely examined the pack.. I realized the red emergency light display was all scratched, no biggie, but was surprised since it was supposed to be a new unit.. I then powered on the device and it showed a battery percentage of 48%, then approx. 3 seconds later it dropped to 1%, then shut off. Been charging it for almost 4hrs and still shows at 1%. Bought it based off of great reviews, could be a defective unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bibi Martinez

product_meta.title: WawaAuto All-Weather Foldable Auto Traction Mat Tire Grip Aid, Car Escape Mat, Non-Slip Mat, Ideal to Unstuck Your Car from Snow, Ice, Mud, and Sand (2-Pack)
product_meta.description:
The Best Choice For Your Car

* As the weather gets worse and we approaching the heavy snow storm season, you need to prepare yourself for the unexpected with the anti slip Snow Traction Mat.

* The mats are all year, all weather use, can be used winter in the snow, and Summer in the mud, If you use it once, you'll never travel without it.

* This car escape traction mat provides emergency traction for your auto tires, gets the car out of snow, ice, mud or sand. It is designed with hexagonal honeycomb for superior traction and increased friction.



Product instruction

1. Effective usage, please clear the snow, sand, clay and other obstructs near the tires.

2. When using, please make sure to clamp the product between the tire and ground.

3. Adjust the product towards direction of the rolling tires.



Specification

Dimensions (Each): 22 inches (L) x 7 inches (W) x 1/2 inches (H).

Pack of 2
feature_bullets: Dimensions (Each): 22 inches (L) x 7 inches (W) x 1/2 inches (H). Pack of 2.
The traction track mats are directional. Please keep the side with indication of "This Side Up" facing up.
Provides emergency traction aid for your auto tires, gets the car out of snow, ice, mud or sand.
With adjustable angel, situable for various roadway. All-weather and foldable.
Hexagonal honeycomb design, increasing friction. Lightweight, Easy to carry. Bear up to 3.5T.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars301 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
